page.title: 05EMPLOYMENT IN FLEETWOOD
page.content: Unemployment is steadily rising in Fleetwood. In October 1984, in the Fylde alone, the rate of unemployment was 19.3%. At present (1985) this figure has risen to 21.6%, of which 65% are male. However, this does not reflect the true amount of unemployed women as many housewives and mothers do not register. On leaving school, 13% of children go straight into employment, 70% go on {Youth Training Schemes.}30% of those partaking in YTS are actually kept on when their time in training expires. This leaves 17% some of which go to 6th form or Technical Colleges and some inevitably are on The Dole. The industries that employ the greatest amount in this area are (a){Lofthouses = 140 (b){ICI = 1880
